a.style: font-family:"Playfair Display", Georgia, "Times New Roman", serif

text.tspan: Child death rates by cause for boys vs. girls in India, 2017
Child death rates are here measured as the number of deaths of children aged 1 to 4 years old per 100,000. This is
shown in India for different causes of death in infant boys versus girls. Causes which lie below the grey line have
higher death rates in girls relative to boys.
Source: IHME, Global Burden of Disease (2018)
